'''''Parma Eldalamberon 6''''' is the sixth issue of ''[[Parma Eldalamberon]]'', a journal of linguistic studies of the Elvish languages and names in the works of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].

It is the first issue after its revival by [[Christopher Gilson]]. John Closson contributed with the front cover calligraphy, and Silas Andrews with interior artwork.

It includes a letter from [[Rhona Beare]] that reports brief notes made on a draft version of [[Thrór's Map]]. These notes consist of the phrase ''"Five feet high the door and three may walk abreast"'' in [[Noldorin]] and [[Old English]]. Rhone Beare copied the notes from the map when it was on display in an exhibition of "Cartographic Curiosities" at The British Museum. The draft version of Thrór's Map is included in ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: Artist and Illustrator]]'', figure 85.<ref>''An Illustrated Tolkien Bibliography'' at Tolkienbooks.net</ref>
{{PEnav|5|7}}

==Contents==
* Cover: Poem "''Undóme Lóriendesse''" ("Twilight in Lórien") — calligraphy by John Closson, art by Christopher Gilson
* Editorial

* Articles
** "The Role of Telerin in the Development of Sindarin" — [[Bill Welden]]
** "An High-elven Glossary" — compiled by Christopher Gilson
** "Conjectures on the Origin of Quenya" — [[Rhona Beare]]

* Mathoms
* Runes: Letters to ''Parma''
* Back cover: "[[:File:Map of Beleriand and Eriador.png|Map of Beleriand and Eriador]]" — Christopher Gilson
